channel.title: (Question) C Safing
channel.description:
Hey. I maded a program using C. It is working etc etc. You can Full in username and Reason And it both comes on a text screen. But would someone tell me how i make a safe button? So when someone close the list and later open it that it still have the same words on the text screen?
I hope i been clear enough :O
Thank you YouriDudock.

item.title: (Question) C Safing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“youridudock, post:5, topic:395654”]And i was thinking may there was a methode that creates a file and save the things from the textbalk to it.
So u can load that later…[/quote]
You might be able to find one on the internet to do that, but there is certainly not one in the standard C library.

Read full topic

item.title: (Question) C Safing
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

I live in The Netherlands

And i was thinking may there was a methode that creates a file and save the things from the textbalk to it.
So u can load that later…

Read full topic

item.title: (Question) C Safing
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“youridudock, post:3, topic:395654”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=492847.msg3603239#msg3603239 date=1305830640]
Ah, you mean ‘saving’, not ‘safing’ (which isn’t a word).

Anyway, you can simply write them out to a text file, then read the text file back in when your program starts again.
[/quote]

Mh, Also a option Well i will search google for some mins if that not work then i use the read back methode lol.
Thank you

YouriDudock[/quote]How else do you plan on saving things besides saving to disk…? That’s the only way to go about it. There may be different formats to save in, but all saving is done through files.

And please tell me English is a second language to you.

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

Ah, you mean ‘saving’, not ‘safing’ (which isn’t a word).
